issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
From a user:
------
We have successfully installed Eucalyptus and built a private cloud in our
laboratory.We launched a linux instance from the linux image Eucalyptus  supplies and the instance was running well.Later We tried  to make a windows image according  to the User Guide and we got it .Now we
have  deployed one of our pre-existing applications into the windows image.

However, it's not the FastStart but the Installation Guide that we use to
set up our private cloud. We installed the CLC,Walrus,CC and SC on one
machine (Frontend) and installed NC on another machine and the third
machine was configured to be the eucalyptus client.

Things are not always good.We have met a lot of problems during the
installation and deployment process.The hardest thing is that the cloud is
not stable enough.Constantly, the node controller was found fail ,which
resulted in the problem that we can't find the existing resources. for
example ,when we input the command:
euca-describe-availability-zones verbose

the result is:

AVAILABILITYZONE cluster01 192.168.1.101
arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc-192.168.1.101/
AVAILABILITYZONE |- vm types    free / max cpu ram disk
AVAILABILITYZONE |- m1.small    0000 / 0000 1 128 2
AVAILABILITYZONE |- c1.medium 0000 / 0000 1 256 5
AVAILABILITYZONE |- m1.large     0000 / 0000 2 512 10
AVAILABILITYZONE |- m1.xlarge   0000 / 0000 2 1024 20
AVAILABILITYZONE |- c1.xlarge    0000 / 0000 4 2048 20

As you can see,there is no available resource we can use to start an
instance.Acctually,the machine where the node controller was installed is
wealthy enough to run several instances.Once the node controller was going well and there were some available resources and we successfully start the linux instance.Then we stopped  NC and tried to make windows image and unfortunately when we finished it ,there is no available resource for us to start the windows image.To make matters worse?there is no nc.log file on the node now and we can't find the reason why the NC went wrong. This makes us feel upset.

Here are some suggestions for you except the unstable problem:

1. There are some unintelligible content of the operation manual.

    For example,we had been confused for a long time when we made the
windows image according to the User Guide. We didn't get the real meaning
of that part of the Guide book until we post a question on the official
forum to ask for help. and finally one of the eucalyptus team members
helped us and we were told that there is a bug in the file.here is the
page.
https://engage.eucalyptus.com/customer/portal/questions/668036-install-eucalyptus-windows-integration
These uncertain content will make the new starter waste a lot of time.

2. Can you please gather the normal problems that may appear during the
installation and the deployment and the solutions  into a document ? This
will do a great favor to the beginners. for example,at first we tried to
install Eucalyptus on the 32 bit linux OS and failed. I didn't  know why
until I  found a message which was sent by one of the eucalyptus team
members to other people.it said that Eucalyptus  must be installed on the
62bit OS but there is no direction about this on the installation
guide.Maybe there will be more beginners to meet the same problem.

3. Can we get some details about the Eucalyptus except the 4 guide books to make a deep understand of the inner workings principle  of Eucalyptus  so that we can solve the problems we will meet  more easily. it seemed that NC is easier to be bad. for example ,Once I reinstalled the NC and started the NC service  ,but there was no log file for NC and I thought that I must
fail to install NC but the eucalyptus team member told me the the log is
only generated after the CC successfully access the nc . Therefore? I think
it?s good for us to know more about the inner working principle of
eucalyptus.
------
User also needs:
 ------
"to make a automated migration tool on the basis of Eucalyptus. I wonder if Eucalyptus have provided users some tools for the pre-existing app's migration to the Eucalyptus private cloud? If we want to deploy our existing application on the cloud, should we only follow the below steps?firstly, start a windows or linux VM using the virtualization tools(kvm or xen); secondly ,log into the VM and deploy our app on the VM ; thirdly, upload the image you made to the Walrus; fourthly,launch your instance using the administrative command line interface or  the web-based user interface. Am I right? Is there any other methods ?  Can you please give me some suggestions about the automated migration tool ? Should I must be familiar with the Eucalyptus API?"
fields.summary: Faststart and/or User Guide Doc Improvements

comments.body: Have to push this out and work with a SME.
